result.text: 3.1.1. Production of lithium iron phosphate cathode material
The cathode material of lithium iron phosphate batteries is generally prepared with the raw materials, ferric phosphate, and lithium

Table 3 List of substances in the production process of the lithium iron phosphate cathode material.
Name of substanceUnitMagnitude
InputMaterials and reagentsFerric phosphatekg2.41E+00
Lithium carbonatekg6.02E-01
Glucosekg2.41E-01
Nitrogenkg2.24E-02
Waterkg5.78E-01
OutputAir pollutantsCarbon dioxideg4.12E+00
Dustg2.31E-01
Water pollutantsSuspended solidsg1.64E-02
Total phosphorusg1.20E-04
ProductCathode materialkg2.41E+00

carbonate by adding carbon source and water, stirring to disperse, grinding, spray drying, sintering in a roller hearth furnace with nitrogen, sieving, and demagnetising. The production process is shown in Fig. 2, and the inventory is shown in Table 3.
The ferric phosphate is prepared by the reaction of ferrous sulphate with phosphoric acid, as demonstrated in Fig. 3; the inventory is shown in Table 4.

The other battery materials required for producing lithium iron phosphate cells include lithium carbonate, anode material, electrolyte, copper foil, aluminium foil, separator, and a housing case. The lists of substances for the production of these materials are shown in Table 5.
